thread.title: Prince Fielder is trading in his batting gloves for an oven mitt | For The Win
thread.title_full: Prince Fielder is trading in his batting gloves for an oven mitt | For The Win

author: Michelle R. Martinelli
title: Prince Fielder is trading in his batting gloves for an oven mitt | For The Win
text:
Prince Fielder is trading in his batting gloves for an oven mitt Prince Fielder is trading in his batting gloves for an oven mitt By Michelle R. Martinelli February 10, 2017 10:23 am Follow @MMartinelli4 396 shares By: Michelle R. Martinelli | February 10, 2017 10:23 am Follow @MMartinelli4 
Sadly, the days of watching Prince Fielder knock home runs out of the park are long gone , but early in his retirement, he’s embarking on something he’s always wanted to do: a food show. 
After an unexpected departure from baseball last season following his second spinal-fusion surgery, the 32-year-old slugger announced his retirement. But he recently told ESPN.com that while he’s “living a normal life,” he had always thought a food show “might be a cool thing to do.” 
And in an early retirement, he’s going for it, co-hosting with his wife, Chanel. 
Via ESPN.com : 
I have a food show that’s going to be streaming on Netflix and Hulu. It’s coming out around the beginning of spring training in March, I believe. It’s not just baseball people. It’s a mixture of baseball people, actors, musicians, chefs and whatnot. They bring out different dishes, and at the end of the show, I give the one I like the most the “Fielder’s choice.” It’s good TV.” 
Some of the guest stars Fielder said will be on his show include New York Yankees pitcher CC Sabathia, actor Chazz Palminteri, singer Jose Feliciano and rapper Xzibit. A photo posted by Prince Fielder (@officialprince84) on Jan 27, 2017 at 4:01pm PST 
Making the most of his sudden retirement, Fielder added : “You don’t need to have a perfect ending to be happy.”
